courses.title: Introduction to ECE Design
courses.description: An introduction to basic concepts useful for all areas of Electrical and Computer Engineering. Focus on hands-on, team-based activities using robotics.

courses.title: ECE Discovery Studio
courses.description: Students will explore ECE curriculum threads and opportunities available during the undergraduate experience while navigating the early career planning process.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics for Electrical and Computer Engineering.

courses.title: ECE Seminar
courses.description: Speakers with diverse backgrounds and representing many different industries, professions, and institutions describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

courses.title: ECE Seminar
courses.description: Speakers with diverse backgrounds and representing many different industries, professions, and institutions describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

courses.title: ECE Seminar
courses.description: Speakers with diverse backgrounds and representing many different industries, professions, and institutions describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

courses.title: Digital System Design
courses.description: Computer system and digital design principles.  Switch and gate design, Boolean algebra, number systems, arithmetic, storage elements.  Datapath, memory organization, instruction set architecture, assembly language.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 2020 and ECE 2030.

courses.title: Introduction to Signal Processing
courses.description: Introduction to discrete-time signal processing and linear systems.  Sampling theorem, filtering, frequency response, Discrete Fourier Transform, Z-Transform.  Laboratory emphasizes computer-based signal processing.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 2026 and ECE 2025.

courses.title: Digital Design Laboratory
courses.description: Design and implementation of digital systems, including a team  design project.  CAD tools, project design methodologies, logic synthesis, and assembly language programming.

courses.title: Programming for Hardware/Software Systems
courses.description: Creation of complex execution and storage mechanisms, based on instruction set architecture, for software design including high-level programming languages and operating systems.  Programming design projects.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 2035 and ECE 3035.

courses.title: Engineering Software Design
courses.description: Object-oriented software methods for engineering applications.  Numerical analysis methods; simulations and graphical presentation of simulation results; analysis of numerical precision.  Programming projects.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 2036 and ECE 3090.

courses.title: Circuit Analysis
courses.description: Basic concepts of DC and AC circuit theory and analysis.

courses.title: Practical Skills and Design
courses.description: This course teaches practical skills, such as soldering and prototyping, and introduces students to ECE design.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent Research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: special topics.

courses.title: Professional and Technical Communications for ECE
courses.description: Written, oral, and visual communication skills required by electrical and computer engineers.  Prepares students for advanced communication tasks required in academic and professional settings.

courses.title: ECE Design Fundamentals
courses.description: This course teaches system-level design, including both software and hardware. Through activities and projects, students gain exposure to entrepreneurship, product lifecycle management, prototyping, and testing.

courses.title: Electromagnetics
courses.description: To present the laws and applications of electromagnetics.

courses.title: Physical Foundations of Computer Engineering
courses.description: Basic principles governing the physical realization of computing systems and their relationship to characteristics such as performance, energy, and robustness.  Implementation technologies.

courses.title: Microelectronic Circuits
courses.description: Basic concepts of microelectronic materials, devices, and circuits.

courses.title: ECE 3040 Recitation
courses.description: ECE 3040 Recitation.

courses.title: Measurements, Circuits, and Microelectronics Laboratory
courses.description: Basic electronic test instrumentation.  Elementary passive and active circuits using both discrete (diodes, bipolar junction transistors, MOSFETs) and integrated devices (operational amplifiers).  Credit not allowed for both ECE 3043 and ECE 3041.

courses.title: Architecture, Systems, Concurrency, and Energy in Computation
courses.description: Basic organizational principles of the major components of a processor – the core, memory hierarchy, I/O subsystem and basic operating system constructs that utilize them.

courses.title: Electrical Energy Systems
courses.description: Non-renewable and renewable/sustainable energy sources.  Processes, costs, and environmental impact of conversion into electric energy.  Delivery and control of electric energy, electromechanical systems.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 3072 and ECE 3071.

courses.title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics for ECE
courses.description: Introduction to probability, random variables, distributions, estimation, confidence intervals, linear regression and other tools for describing and managing uncertainty in electrical and computer engineering.

courses.title: Signals and Systems
courses.description: Continuous-time linear systems and signals, their mathematical representations, and computational tools.  Fourier and Laplace transforms, convolutions, input-output responses, stability.

courses.title: VLSI and Advanced Digital Design
courses.description: Advanced digital design issues in the context of VLSI systems. Introduction to a design methodolgy that encompasses the range from architectural models to circuit simulation. Credit not awarded for ECE 3150 and ECE 3060.

courses.title: Cryptographic Hardware for Embedded Systems
courses.description: Introduction to cryptography and authentication from a hardware-centric perspective.  Historic ciphers, symmetric and asymmetric encryption, and power analysis attacks are taught from a digital and VLSI design perspective.

courses.title: Optimization for Information Systems
courses.description: An introduction to the fundamentals of optimization with a focus on algorithms and applications in signal processing, control systems, machine learning, and robotics.

courses.title: Electromechanical and Electromagnetic Energy Conversion
courses.description: Introduction to three phase power systems, electromechanical energy conversion and operating principles of electric machines.

courses.title: Analog Electronics
courses.description: Analysis and design of electronic circuits and systems.  Biasing, small-signal analysis, frequency response, feedback amplifiers, active filters, non-linear op-amp applications, and oscillators.

courses.title: Semiconductor Devices
courses.description: Properties of semiconductor devices.  Applications in current and future computers, fiber optic and wireless communication systems.  Future needs of high frequency, GHz-range, device operation.

courses.title: Feedback Control Systems
courses.description: Analysis and design of control systems.  Laplace transforms, transfer functions, and stability.  Feedback systems: tracking and disturbance rejection.  Graphical design techniques.

courses.title: Computer Communications
courses.description: Basic concepts of computer communication network protocols.

courses.title: Circuits and Electronics
courses.description: An introduction to electric circuit elements and electronic devices and a study of circuits containing such devices.

courses.title: Instrumentation and Electronics Lab
courses.description: Basic analog and digital electronic circuits and principles. Techniques of electrical and electronic measurements with laboratory instruments.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research I
courses.description: Participation in an individual or group research project under the direction of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research II
courses.description: Participation in an individual or group research project under the direction of a faculty member. Requires a formal research report.

courses.title: ECE Culminating Design Project I
courses.description: First semester of ECE culminating design sequence.  Design tools, financial principles, project management, probabilistic and statistical techniques, team forming.  Requires formal reports and group presentations.

courses.title: ECE Culminating Design Project II
courses.description: Second semester of ECE culminating design sequence.  Team project in ECE incorporating engineering standards and realistic constraints.  Requires formal reports and group presentations.

courses.title: ECE Culminating Design I
courses.description: First course in a culminating design sequence.  Student teams design, build, test, document, demonstrate prototype system reflective of knowledge gained as an undergraduate engineering student.

courses.title: ECE Culminating Design II
courses.description: Second course in a culminating design sequence.  Student teams design, build, test, document, demonstrate prototype system reflective of knowledge gained as an undergraduate engineering student.

courses.title: ECE-Only Single-Semester Capstone Design
courses.description: A single-semester ECE culminating design experience forming ECE-only teams, proposing, prototyping, testing, demonstrating, formally presenting and documenting projects incorporating engineering standards and realistic constraints.

courses.title: Senior Analog Electronics Laboratory
courses.description: Experiments in analog electronics using discrete devices and off-the-shelf integrated circuits.

courses.title: Research Methods
courses.description: Course provides methods and practices for literature searching, reference management, and summary preparation. Coverage  includes journals, conferences, theses, patents, grants, roadmaps, and companies.

courses.title: Advanced Computer Architecture
courses.description: Comprehensive coverage of the architecture and system issues that confront the design of high-performance workstation/PC computer architectures with emphasis on quantitative evaluation. Credit is not allowed for both ECE 4100 and any of the following courses: ECE 6100, CS 4290, CS 6290.

courses.title: Internetwork Security
courses.description: Hands-on experimentation and evaluation of internet security theory, principles, and practices. Laboratory component involves implementing both defensive and offensive security techniques. Credit not awarded for both ECE 4112 and ECE 4115.

courses.title: Introduction to Computer Security
courses.description: Introductory topics in computer security are presented with an emphasis on fundamental security primitives and current security challenges facing society. Credit not awarded for both ECE 4115 and ECE 4112.

courses.title: Introduction to Malware Reverse Engineering
courses.description: This course exposes students to an immersive, hands-on experience in the dissection and analysis of the code, structure, and functionality of malicious software.

courses.title: Advanced Programming Techniques for Engineering Applications
courses.description: Course covers a number of programming techniques for distributed and parallel computing and other advanced methods, such as multiprecision arithmetic and nonblocking I/O. Credit not awarded for ECE 4122 and ECE 6122.

courses.title: Advanced VLSI Systems
courses.description: An advanced treatment of VLSI systems analysis, design, and testing with emphasis on complex systems and how they are incorporated into a silicon environment. Credit is not allowed for both ECE 4130 and ECE 6130.

courses.title: Adv Malware Analysis
courses.description: This course covers advanced approaches for the analysis of malicious software and explores recent research and unsolved problems in software protection and forensics.

courses.title: Cloud Computing
courses.description: Cloud computing technologies, computation models, and applications, design methodologies for cloud applications, use of cloud-based languages and tools in developing advanced applications.

courses.title: Hardware-Oriented Security and Trust
courses.description:
Fundamental concepts, foundation, and methodologies for the design of trustworthy circuits including protection of the
hardware platform against tampering. Physical cloning of cryptographic VLSI circuits.

courses.title: Embedded Systems Design
courses.description: Processors, chipsets, busses, and I/O devices for high-ended embedded systems. Embedded operating systems; device drivers and applications for embedded systems.

courses.title: Embedded Computing Systems
courses.description: Algorithms and methodologies for the design of real-time, low-power embedded computing systems.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Machine Learning (FunML)
courses.description: An introduction to the fundamentals and applications of Machine Learning. Students cannot receive credit for both ECE 4252 and CS 4641.

courses.title: Digital Image Processing
courses.description: An introduction to the Fundamentals of Image Processing.

courses.title: Random Signals and Applications
courses.description: Introduction to random signals and processes with emphasis on applications in ECE.  Includes basic estimation theory, linear prediction, and statistical modeling.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Digital Signal Processing
courses.description: Introduction to digital signal processing. Sampling theorem, discrete-time Fourier transform. Power spectrum, discrete Fourier transform and the FFT algorithm, Z-transform, digital filter design and implementation.

courses.title: Applications of Digital Signal Processing
courses.description: Applications of DSP in speech, image processing, radar, pattern recognition, and adaptive filtering requiring working software implementations applied to the analysis of real signals.

courses.title: Design Synthesis of Application-specific Signal Processors
courses.description: Fundamentals of theory and practice of DSP chip design in VHDL. Exposure to tools and environments for chip design, simulation, and verification.

courses.title: Power System Analysis and Control
courses.description: Introduces basic concepts in electric power generation, distribution, system control, and economic operation.

courses.title: Power System Engineering
courses.description: To introduce basic concepts of electric power system design, encompassing protection, stability, and control.

courses.title: Electric Power Quality
courses.description: Transients and harmonics in power systems, analysis methods and mitigation practices.  Causes of power quality problems and relationship to equipment susceptibility.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 4325 and ECE 6340.

courses.title: Power Electronics
courses.description: Introduces power semiconductor devices and power electronic converters, including single-phase and three-phase ac/dc rectifiers, ac voltage controllers, dc/dc converters, and dc/ac inverters.

courses.title: Electric Machinery Analysis
courses.description: Advanced theory of AC machines, including AC motor winding design, finite element analysis, induction motor design, permanent magnet machine design, and synchronous machine dynamics.  Credit is not allowed for both ECE 4335 and ECE 6335.

courses.title: Electromagnetic and Microwave Applications
courses.description: Presents concepts of electromagnetic fields applied to microwave circuit design and antenna radiation. Credit will not be awarded for ECE 4350 and ECE 3065.

courses.title: RF-Microwave Measurement Laboratory
courses.description: RF/microwave measurement theory and techniques. Use of state-of-the-art equipment operating into the GHz range.

courses.title: Antenna Engineering
courses.description: Basic theory, application, and design of a broad range of antennas.

courses.title: Antenna Engineering Laboratory
courses.description: Experimentation to develop a practical understanding of antennas and their properties.

courses.title: Introduction to Radar and Electromagnetic Sensing
courses.description: Introduces students to radar systems, including pulsed, CW, CWFM, and MTI radars. Other techniques for electromagnetic sensing such as radiometry and EM tagging are discussed.

courses.title: Electromagnetic Compatibility
courses.description: To study electromagnetic interference and susceptibility of electrical systems, with application to analog and digital circuits.

courses.title: RF Engineering I
courses.description: Fundamentals of RF engineering. Components at high frequencies, device modeling, amplifiers, lumped-element and microstrip impedance transformation networks, S-parameter-based design of RF and microwave amplifiers.

courses.title: RF Engineering II
courses.description: Fundamentals learned in RF-I are employed to design the elements of radio receivers, transmitters, and similar systems.  Systems analysis, mixers, detectors, power amplifiers, low-noise amplifiers, and oscillators are covered.

courses.title: Digital Integrated Circuits
courses.description: Analysis and design of bipolar and MOS digital integrated circuit families and their applications in modern electronic systems.

courses.title: Analog Integrated Circuits
courses.description: Analysis and design of analog ICs using analytic techniques and CAD tools. Topics include amplifiers, current sources, output circuits, and other analog building blocks.

courses.title: Operational Amplifier Design
courses.description: Analysis and design techniques for utilization of integrated circuit operational amplifiers for applications in electronic systems.

courses.title: Audio Engineering
courses.description: Concepts of acoustics and electroacoustic modeling for the analysis and design of microphones, loudspeakers, and crossover networks. Methods of analysis and design of audio power amplifiers.

courses.title: Audio Engineering Laboratory
courses.description: A companion laboratory to ECE 4445. Design, analysis, construction, modeling, and testing of circuits and systems pertaining to audio engineering.

courses.title: Guitar Amplification and Effects
courses.description: Mathematical analysis and laboratory measurement of vibrating strings, electromagnetic pickups, vacuum tube amplifiers, solid-state distortion, and swept filter effects.

courses.title: Analog Circuits for Music Synthesis
courses.description: Circuits from classic analog synthesizers: nonlinear waveshapers and voltage-controlled oscillators, filters, and amplifier using operational transconductance amplifliers and the dynamic resistance of semiconductors.

courses.title: IC Fabrication
courses.description: Introduction to microelectronic processing technologies and CMOS. Includes a laboratory for fabrication/testing of MOS transistors, basic CMOS circuits, integrated resistors and capacitors. Credit will not be awarded for ECE 4452 and ECE 4752.

courses.title: Introduction to Electronic Systems Packaging
courses.description: Introduction to packaging technologies, technology drivers, electrical performance, thermal management, materials, optoelectronics, RF integration, reliability, system issues, assembly, testing.

courses.title: Devices for Renewable Energy
courses.description: Students study the engineering compromises, operational physics and environmental impact of a variety of devices from solar cells, batteries, thermoelectric devices and wind generators.

courses.title: Optical Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to applications of geometric, physical optics to engineering, including optical measurements, matrix methods, instruments, interference, holography, beam optics, Fourier optics, and diffraction.

courses.title: Optical Fiber Communications
courses.description: Combined lecture-laboratory exploration of the technology of fiber optics, with emphasis on optical fiber communication systems. Credit will not be awarded for ECE 4502 and ECE 4501.

courses.title: Control System Design
courses.description: Design of control algorithms using state-space methods, microcontroller implementation of control algorithms, and laboratory projects emphasizing motion control applications.

courses.title: Introduction to Automation and Robotics
courses.description: Concurrent engineering principles; robotic manipulator kinematics, dynamics, and control; applications of robots in industry, medicine, and other areas; team projects and hands-on laboratory experience.

courses.title: System Theory for Communication and Control
courses.description: Study of the basic concepts in linear system theory and numerical linear algebra with applications to communication, computation, control, and signal processing. A unified treatment.

courses.title: Numerical Methods for Optimization and Optimal Control
courses.description: Algorithms for numerical optimization and optimal control, Gradient-descent techniques, linear programming, numerical linear system solvers, second-order methods of optimizing performance of dynamical systems.

courses.title: Computational Computer Vision
courses.description: Computational and theoretical aspects of computer vision. Application areas include robotics, autonomous vehicles, tracking, and image-guided surgery. Includes major project.

courses.title: Communication Systems
courses.description: To present the fundamentals of modern digital communication systems and evaluate their performance with realistic channel models.

courses.title: Topics in Networks
courses.description: Reviews on networking fundamentals. Latest networking technologies in wireless and wireline networks. Machine learning and data science in networks or other emerging topics. Projects included.

courses.title: Wireless Communications
courses.description: Cellular concept, wireless propagation modeling; types of digital modulation used in wireless systems, diversity combining, performance over fading channels, and multiple access techniques.

courses.title: Mobile and Wireless Networks
courses.description: Basics of mobile and wireless networking. Architectures and communication protocols for wireless sensor networks, wireless local area networks, ad-hoc networks, cellular systems, WiMAX, and Wireless Mesh Networks.

courses.title: Telecommunications Systems Laboratory
courses.description: Basic digital telecommunications systems are examined in a laboratory setting using electronic modules, covering concepts such as modulation, channel coding, AWGN, eye diagrams, and BER. Credit will not be awarded for ECE 4612 and ECE 4602.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent Research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Interdisciplinary Capstone Design
courses.description: Seniors will work in teams to apply a systematic design process to real multi-disciplinary problems. Problems selected from a broad spectrum of interest areas, including biomedical, environmental, mechanical, industrial design, electrical and thermal/fluids. Projects must be based on the knowledge and skills acquired in earlier course work, and incorporate appropriate engineering standards and multiple realistic constraints. Emphasis is placed on the design process, the technical aspects of the design, and on reducing the proposed design to practice.  The course consists of faculty and guest lectures, prototyping in design studios, and a multi-disciplinary design project.

courses.title: Laser Theory and Applications
courses.description: Provides an introduction to the theory and applications of laser principles and related instrumentation. Emphasis is on the fundamental principles underlying laser action. Crosslisted with PHYS 4751.

courses.title: Topics in Engineering Practice
courses.description: Topics of current importance offered in collaboration with an approved partner of Georgia Tech's Distance Learning Program. Crosslisted with ME 4753.

courses.title: Electronics Packaging Assembly, Reliability, Thermal Management, and Test
courses.description: The course provides hands-on instruction in electronics packaging, including assembly, reliability, thermal management, and test of next-generation microsystems.  Crosslisted with ME and MSE 4754.

courses.title: Electronic Packaging Substrate Fabrication
courses.description: This course provides hands-on instruction in basic packaging substrate fabrication techniques, including interconnect design and testing, dielectric deposition, via formation, and metallization.  Crosslisted with CHE 4755.

courses.title: Biomedical Instrumentation
courses.description: A study of medical instrumentation from a systems viewpoint. Pertinent physiological and electro-physiological concepts will be covered. Credit not allowed for both ECE 4781 and (CHE 4781 or CHBE 4781 or  BMED 4781 or ME 4781).

courses.title: Biosystems Analysis
courses.description: Analytical methods for modeling biological systems, including white-noise protocols for characterizing nonlinear systems. Crosslisted with BMED, CHE and ME 4782.

courses.title: Introduction to Medical Image Processing
courses.description: A study of mathematical methods used in medical acquisition and processing.  Concepts, algorithms, and methods associated with acquisition, processing, and display of two- and three-dimensional medical images are studied.  Crosslisted with BMED 4783.

courses.title: Engineering Electrophysiology
courses.description: Basic concepts of electrophysiology from an engineering perspective. Functionality of relevant organs and systems; instrumentation tools which monitor electrophysiology function. Crosslisted with BMED 4784.

courses.title: Medical Imaging Systems
courses.description: Introduce major biomedical and clinical imaging modalities including X-ray radiography, computed tomography (CT), nuclear medicine (SPECT and PET), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and ultrasound.

courses.title: GPU Programming for Video Games
courses.description: 3-D graphics pipelines. Physically-based rendering. Game engine architectures. GPU architectures. Graphics APIs. Vertex and pixel shader programming. Post-processing effects. Deferred rendering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: special topics.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: special topics.

courses.title: ECE Single-Semester Create-X Capstone Design
courses.description: A single-semester ECE culminating design experience in which interdisciplinary teams propose, prototype, test, demonstrate, formally present, and document projects incorporating engineering standards and realistic constraints.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics in ECE.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics in ECE.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research I
courses.description: Participation in an individual or group research project under the direction of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research II
courses.description: Participation in an individual or group research project under the direction of a faculty member.

courses.title: Technology Entrepreneurship: Teaming, Ideation, Entrepreneurship, Intrepreneurship, and Leadership
courses.description:
Principles of entrepreneurship and intrapreneurship: teaming, ideation, and leadership. Customer
discovery, cognitive biases, rapid prototyping, business models, negotiation, and capital raises will be also covered.

courses.title: Advanced Computer Architecture
courses.description: Comprehensive coverage of the architecture and system issues that confront the design of high-performance workstation/PC computer architectures with emphasis on quantitative evaluation.  Credit is not allowed for both ECE 6100 and any of the following courses: ECE 4100, CS 4290, CS 6290.

courses.title: Dependable Distributed Systems
courses.description: Concepts, theory, and practice of dependable distributed systems. Techniques for tolerating hardware and software faults. Security aspects such as confidentiality, availability, and integrity.

courses.title: CAD for Computer Communication Networks
courses.description: Models and algorithms for simulation-based design and evaluation of computer networks and network protocols.

courses.title: Interconnection Networks for High-Performance Systems
courses.description: Architecture, design methodology, and trade offs of interconnection networks at various scales – on-chip (for multicore CPUs and accelerators) and off-chip (for HPC and datacenters)

courses.title: Advanced Programming Techniques
courses.description: Covers a number of advanced topics in programming methods, data management, distributed computing, and advanced algorithms used in typical engineering applications. Credit will not be awarded for ECE 6122 and ECE 4122.

courses.title: Advanced VLSI Systems
courses.description: An advanced treatment of VLSI systems analysis, design, and testing with emphasis on complex systems and how they are incorporated into a silicon environment.  Credit is not allowed for both ECE 4130 and ECE 6130.

courses.title: Computer-aided VLSI System Design
courses.description: Theory and practice of computer-aided VLSI digital systems design.   Logic synthesis, semi-custom VLSI design, high-level synthesis, low-power systems, and hardware/software co-design.  Individual and group projects.

courses.title: Physical Design Automation of VLSI Systems
courses.description: Various design automation problems in the physical design process of VLSI circuits including clustering, partitioning, floor planning, placement, routing, and compaction.

courses.title: Digital Systems in Nanometer Nodes
courses.description: An advanced treatment of design challenges, such as power, variability, and reliability associated with digital integrated circuits and systems in nanometer nodes.

courses.title: Digital Systems Test
courses.description: Course covers the science of digital systems testing, fault models, algorithms for fault simulation and test generation, design for testability and built-in self-test.

courses.title: Hardware-Oriented Security and Trust
courses.description:
Fundamental concepts, foundation, and methodologies for the design of trustworthy circuits including protection of the
hardware platform against tampering. Physical cloning of cryptographic VLSI circuits.

courses.title: Biomedical Applications of Microelectromechanical Systems
courses.description: MEMS processing technologies, design of fabrication process flows, and applications of the technologies to the development of biomedical micro instrumentation and dectection methodologies.

courses.title: Introduction to Microelectromechanical Systems
courses.description: Introduction to Micro-Electro-Mechanical systems: Microfabrication techniques including: photolithography, etching, physical and chemical vapor deposition, electroplating, bonding and polymer processing.  Application to sensors and actuators.  Credit not allowed for both ECE 6229 and ME 6229 or CHBE 6229.

courses.title: Advanced Digital Signal Processing
courses.description: An introduction to advanced signal processing methods that are used in a variety of applications areas.

courses.title: Statistical Machine Learning
courses.description: An introduction to the theory of statistical learning and practical machine learning algorithms with applications in signal processing and data analysis.

courses.title: Digital Processing of Speech Signals
courses.description: The application of digital signal processing to problems in speech communication. Part of this goal requires a laboratory project.

courses.title: Digital Image Processing
courses.description: An introduction to the theory of multidimensional signal processing and digital image processing, including key applications in multimedia products and services, and telecommunications.

courses.title: Data Compression and Modeling
courses.description: Theory and algorithms of signal encoding and decoding for data compression.  Applications in information systems, digital telephony, digital television, and multimedia Internet.

courses.title: Convex Optimization: Theory, Algorithms, and Applications
courses.description: This course provides an introduction to convex optimization, covering the mathematical fundamentals of convex analysis and duality theory, algorithms, and modelling of practical applications.

courses.title: Adaptive Filtering
courses.description: Basic theory of adaptive filter design and implementation. Steepest decent, LMS algorithms, nonlinear adaptive filters, and neural networks. Analysis of performance and applications.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Radar Signal Processing
courses.description: Signal modeling including radar cross section, multipath, and clutter. Properties of the ambiguity function and coded waveforms. Algorithms for Doppler processing, detection, and radar imaging.

courses.title: Methods of Pattern Recognition with Application to Voice
courses.description: Theory and application of pattern recognition with a special application section for automatic speech recognition and related signal processing.

courses.title: Statistical  Natural Language Processing
courses.description: Foundations of statistical natural language processing established for text data analysis, language engineering, information extraction, and statistical inference. Applications using large text datasets are illustrated.

courses.title: DSP Hardware Systems Design
courses.description: A study of theory and practice in the design and implementation of DSP algorithms on programmable processors, multiprocessors, and ASICs.

courses.title: Spatial Array Processing
courses.description: Introduce application areas where signals are sampled over space and time.  Transfer knowledge of time-based techniques to spatial processing. Develop algorithms unique to spatial processing.

courses.title: Cryptography & Security
courses.description: Algebraic and number theory apporaches to cryptographic techniques, information security, secret key and public key encryption, signature schemes, hash functions, message authentication, and key distribution. Credit not allowed for both ECE 6280 and CS 6260.

courses.title: Radar Imaging
courses.description: An indepth study of digital signal processing methods for Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) image formation.  Methods are also applicable to sonar.

courses.title: Harmonic Analysis for Signal Processing
courses.description: Explores the role of sparse representations in signal processing. Specific topics include: frame decompositions, approximation theory, inverse problems, imaging, and compressed sensing.

courses.title: Power Systems Control and Operation
courses.description: Introduction to methods used in the real-time operation and control of power systems as well as to the hardware and software technology of energy management systems (EMS). Credit will not be awarded for both ECE 6320 and ECEP 6301.

courses.title: Power System Stability
courses.description: Techniques for stability analysis of electric power systems and applications of these methods.

courses.title: Power System Planning and Reliability
courses.description: To introduce basic concepts as well as analysis and optimization techniques underlying reliability assessment of electric power systems and planning techniques. Credit will not be awarded for both ECE 6322 and ECEP 6305.

courses.title: Power System Protection
courses.description: Theory and practice of modern power system protection techniques. Credit will not be awarded for both ECE 6323 and ECEP 6351.

courses.title: Power Electronic Circuits
courses.description: The analysis, control, and design of switching power converters: rectifiers, cycloconverters, voltage-sourced and current-source inverters, dc-dc converters, pfc and resonant converts.

courses.title: Electric Machinery Analysis
courses.description: An introduction to the analysis and basic construction principles of rotating electric machines and transformers, including ac synchronous and induction machines and dc machines.  Credit is now allowed for both ECE 4335 and ECE 6335.

courses.title: Dynamics and Control of Electric Machine Drives
courses.description: A study of the dynamics and control of electric machinery and variable speed machine drive systems.

courses.title: Electricity Markets
courses.description: Comprehensive introduction to markets for electrical energy, including economic theory, market design, utility models, effects of the physical grid, and grid services.

courses.title: Applied Electromagnetics
courses.description: The methodology and application of advanced electromagnetic theory.

courses.title: Microwave Design
courses.description: Applications of electromagnetic theory to microwave components and systems.  Introduction to the latest characterization and design techniques including monolithic microwave integrated circuit (MMIC) technology.

courses.title: Microwave Design Laboratory
courses.description: This laboratory course will teach microwave measurement/design fundamentals for both passive and active components.  Students will use both CAD tools and network analyzers.

courses.title: Electromagnetic Radiation and Antennas
courses.description: The fundamentals of electromagnetic radiation and antennas.

courses.title: Cyber-Physical Security in Electric Energy Systems
courses.description: This course provides an introduction to cyber-physical infrastructure for protection and control of electric energy systems, communication protocols, standardization and practices for cyber security.

courses.title: Radio Wave Propagation in the Earth and Space Environment
courses.description: How the Earth’s atmosphere, space plasma environment, and solar space weather, vary to affect communication, navigation, space science, and remote sensing, across the electromagnetic spectrum.

courses.title: Introduction to Computational Electromagnetics
courses.description: The practical application of the finite-difference time-domain and finite element techniques to electromagnetic problems. Computer projects are required.

courses.title: Satellite Communications and Navigation Systems
courses.description: To introduce satellite communications and navigation system design including microwave transmission, satellite transponders, earth station hardware, and satellite networks. A design project is required.

courses.title: Analog Integrated Circuit Design
courses.description: Design of analog circuits using CMOS and bipolar technologies.

courses.title: Analog Integrated System Design
courses.description: Design of analog systems using CMOS and bipolar technologies. A higher level of design for analog and digital systems is presented.

courses.title: Wireless IC Design
courses.description: Wireless system specifications are translated to architectures and building blocks compatible with silicon technology.  The course focuses on the analysis and design of these blocks.

courses.title: Interface IC Design for MEMS and Sensors
courses.description: Design of low-noise interface circuits for sensors and micromechanical devices (MEMS). Design of integrated microsystems.

courses.title: Neuromorphic Analog VLSI Circuits
courses.description: Large-scale analog computation for sensory and motor processing.  Analog building blocks are presented, leading to VLSI systems inspired by neurobiological architectures and computational paradigms.

courses.title: Silicon-Based Heterostructure Devices and Circuits
courses.description: Theory and design of novel silicon-germanium microelectronic devices and circuits.  Materials, device physics, fabrication, measurement, circuit design, and system applications.

courses.title: Power Integrated-Circuit Design
courses.description: Analysis and design of linear dc-dc regulators and switched-inductor dc-dc supplies with CMOS and BiCMOS integrated circuits (ICs).

courses.title: Introduction to Microelectronics Technology
courses.description: Presents the fundamentals of microelectronics material, device, and circuit fabrication.

courses.title: Introduction to the Theory of Microelectronics
courses.description: Basis of quantum mechanics, statistical mechanics, and the behavior of solids to serve as an introduction to the modern study of semiconductors and semiconductor devices.

courses.title: Theory of Electronic Devices
courses.description: Presents the fundamentals of electronic device operation.

courses.title: Semiconductor Process Control
courses.description: This course is designed to explore methods of applying statistical process control and statistical quality control to semiconductor manufacturing processes.  Students will be required to complete a design project.

courses.title: Solar Cells
courses.description: To provide a practical understanding of semiconductor materials and technology as it relates to design and development of efficient solar cells and photovoltaic systems.

courses.title: Gigascale Integration
courses.description: Hierarchy of physical principles that enable understanding and estimation of future opportunities to achieve multibillion transistor silicon chips using sub-0.25 micron technology.

courses.title: Microelectromechanical Devices
courses.description: Fundamental concepts for desgin of microelectromechanical devices (MEMS), including mechanical and thermal behavior of materials and structures, transduction principles, transducer design, and modeling.

courses.title: Memory Device Technologies and Applications
courses.description: This course covers semiconductor memory technologies SRAM, DRAM, FLASH and emerging non-volatile NVMs, including bit-cell design, peripheral circuitry, array architecture, scaling trend and in-memory computing.

courses.title: Fourier Techniques and Signal Analysis
courses.description: Introduction to the use of Fourier Methods for analysis of signals.

courses.title: Fourier Optics and Holography
courses.description: Applications of the Fourier transform and linear systems theory to the analysis of optical propagation, diffraction imaging, holography, wavefront modulation, and signal processing.

courses.title: Electro-Optics
courses.description: Study of the fundamental principles and primary applications of lasers, and of detectors of optical radiation.

courses.title: Nanophotonics
courses.description: Design of nano-structures to guide light and to develop a new set of optical devices.

courses.title: Integrated Optics
courses.description: Theory and design of integrated photonic devices.

courses.title: Nonlinear Optics
courses.description: Provides an introduction to the field of nonlinear optics, exploring the physical mechanisms, applications, and experimental techniques.

courses.title: Modulation, Diffractive, and Crystal Optics
courses.description: Provides a working knowledge of temporal and spatial optical modulation, diffractive optical devices, and crystal optics.

courses.title: Organic Optoelectronics
courses.description: Fundamental understanding of the optical and electronic properties of organic materials and devices that form the basic of the emerging technological area of printed flexible optoelectronics.

courses.title: Optoelectronics: Devices, Integration, Packaging, Systems
courses.description: Optoelectronic devices (detectors, emitters, modulators) from the practical realized and theoretical performance perspective. Explores monolithic and hybrid integration of devices, packaging, and system implementation.

courses.title: Fiber-optic Networks
courses.description: Architectural, performance and design aspects of fiber-optic communications networks, components, and technologies. Relationship between the physical network implementation and the higher-level network architecture.

courses.title: Linear Systems and Controls
courses.description: Introduction to linear system theory and feedback control. Topics include state space representations, controllability and observability, linear feedback control. Credit will not be awarded for both ECE 6550 and AE 6530.

courses.title: Digital Control
courses.description: Techniques for analysis and synthesis of digital control systems. Sample-data systems, state-space systems and linear feedback design.

courses.title: Nonlinear Systems and Control
courses.description: Classical analysis techniques and stability theory for nonlinear systems.  Control design for nonlinear systems, including robotic systems.  Design projects.

courses.title: Optimal Control and Optimization
courses.description: Optimal control of dynamic systems, numerical optimization, techniques and their applications in solving optical-trajectory problems.

courses.title: Adaptive Control
courses.description: Methods of parameter estimation and adaptive control for systems with constant or slowly varying unknown parameters. MATLAB design projects emphasizing applications to physical systems.

courses.title: Optimal Estimation
courses.description: Techniques for signal and state estimation in the presence of measurement and process noise with the emphasis on Wiener and Kalman filtering.

courses.title: Stochastic Systems
courses.description: Advanced techniques in stochastic analysis with emphasis on stochastic dynamics, nonlinear filtering and detection, stochastic control, and stochastic optimization and simulation methods.

courses.title: Advanced Linear Systems
courses.description: Study of multivariable linear system theory and robust control design methodologies.

courses.title: Partial Differential Equations in Image Processing and Computer Vision
courses.description: Mathematical foundations and numerical aspects of partial-differential equation techniques used in computer vision. Topics inculde image smoothing and enhancement, edge detection, morphology, and image reconstruction.

courses.title: Autonomous Control of Robotic Systems
courses.description: Fundamental issues associated with autonomous robot control. Emphasizes biological perspective that forms the basis of many current developments in robotics.

courses.title: Networked Control and Multiagent Systems
courses.description: Covers tools and techniques for networked control systems as well as application domains and promising research directions.

courses.title: Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
courses.description: Introduction to the nonlinear dynamics of continuous-time and discrete-time systems. Routes to chaos. Quantification of chaos. Nonlinear time series analysis. Applications of Chaos Theory.

courses.title: Random Processes
courses.description: To develop the theoretical framework for the processing of random signals and data.

courses.title: Digital Communications
courses.description: Basic M-ary digital communications systems, with emphasis on system design and performance analysis in the presence of additive noise.

courses.title: Advanced Digital Communications
courses.description: The theory and practice of efficient digital communications over dispersive channels, including adaptive equalization and synchronization.

courses.title: Personal and Mobile Communications
courses.description: To introduce various topics that are fundamental to cellular mobile telephone systems.

courses.title: Information Theory
courses.description: To introduce the mathematical theory of communications. Emphasis will be placed on Shannon's theorems and their use in the analysis and design of communication systems.

courses.title: Coding Theory and Applications
courses.description: To introduce the theory and practice of error control coding, with emphasis on linear, cyclic, convolutional, and parallel concatenated codes.

courses.title: Computer Communication Networks
courses.description: Fundamental concepts of computer network architecture and protocols.

courses.title: Wireless Networks
courses.description: Fundamental concepts of wireless networks.

courses.title: Computer Network Security
courses.description: Fundamental concepts of network information security, including encryption, secure access methods, and vulnerabilities in network protocols, operating systems, and network applications.

courses.title: Broadband Access Networks
courses.description: To develop architectures and technologies of wireless and wired broadband access networks including 5G wireless, fiber to the home, hybrid fiber-coax, and digital subscriber line.

courses.title: Sensor Networks
courses.description: Basics of sensor network communications.  Applications, architectures, and communication protocols for sensor networks are treated in depth.

courses.title: Ethics of Biotechnology and Bioengineering Research
courses.description: This course examines the ethics of biotechnological research, including issues in the realm of research ethics, bioethics, and healthcare robotics.

courses.title: Cyber Security Practicum
courses.description: Capstone independent study project placing each student in a commercial, academic or government setting where he or she identifies a major cyber security problem, and explores and evaluates a solution that addresses it with realistic assumptions about the organizational context. The chosen problem must be approved by course instructor. Cross-listed with PUBP and CS 6727.

courses.title: Modeling and Simulation: Foundations and Implementation
courses.description: Foundations and algorithms concerning the development of conceptual models for systems, and their realization in the form of computer software; discrete and continuous models. Crosslisted with CSE 6730.

courses.title: Topics in Engineering Practice
courses.description: Topics of current importance offered in collaboration with an approved partner of Georgia Tech's Distance Learning Program.  Crosslisted with ME 6744.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Malware Analysis
courses.description: This course covers advanced approaches for the analysis of malicious software and explores recent research and unsolved problems in software protection and forensics.

courses.title: Online Decision Making in Machine Learning
courses.description: This course will deal with the design of machine learning algorithms for real-time decision making, including reinforcement learning. Applications in engineering and machine learning will both be discussed.

courses.title: Introduction to Cyber-Physical Systems Security
courses.description: This course provides an introduction to security issues relating to various cyber-physical systems including industrial control systems and those considered critical infrastructure systems.

courses.title: Optoelectronics: Materials, Processes, Devices
courses.description: Optoelectronic materials, physical processes, and devices. Includes compound semiconductor materials, excitation, recombination, gain, and modulation processes and devices such as emitters, detectors, and modulators. Crosslisted with PHYS 6771.

courses.title: Integrated Low-Cost Microelectronics Systems Packaging
courses.description: Introduction to cross-disciplinary microelectronic packaging technologies, including electrical design, thermal considerations and technologies, reliability, optoelectronic packaging, and RF-/mm-packaging. Crosslisted with ME and MSE 6776.

courses.title: Thermal Engineering for Packaging of Micro and Nano Systems
courses.description: Passive, active, and hybrid thermal management techniques, and computational modeling of micro systems. Air cooling, simlge phase and phase change liquid cooling, heat pipes, and thermoelectrics. Crosslisted with ME 6779.

courses.title: Medical Image Processing
courses.description: Studying biomedical image analysis techniques including image enhancement, analysis, classification, and interpretation for medical decision making through practicals and projects. Cross-listed with BMED 6780.

courses.title: Biomedical Sensing Systems
courses.description: A study of physiological sensing topics from a systems viewpoint. Pertinent physiological and electro-physiological concepts will be covered. No prior knowledge of physiology or biology is needed.

courses.title: Medical Imaging Systems
courses.description: A study of the principles and design of medical imaging systems such as X-ray, ultrasound, nuclear medicine, and nuclear magnetic resonance. Crosslisted with BMED 6786.

courses.title: Information Processing Models in Neural Systems
courses.description: Examines "top-down" modeling approaches for sensorineural systems, where optimal computational principles used in engineering(e.g., information theory, Bayesian inference, control theory) explain observed information processing.

courses.title: Manufacturing Seminar
courses.description: Guest speakers on a broad range of manufacturing-related topics: research, applications, and technology. Required for Certificate in Manufacturing. Crosslisted with ISYE and ME 6792.

courses.title: GT-SJTU
courses.description: For GT-SJTU dual-MS students during terms when they are not taking other GT courses.  Placeholder course.

courses.title: GT-TU
courses.description: For GT-TU double-MS students during terms when they are not taking other GT courses.

courses.title: GT-Shenzhen Research
courses.description: For GT-Shenzhen students during terms when they are in Atlanta on research internship with GT-Atlanta faculty.

courses.title: Advanced Memory System
courses.description: Covers the basic trade-offs in architecting a high performance memory hierarchy at all levels, starting from the on-chip cache to main memory and storage sub-system.

courses.title: Advanced Digital Systems Test
courses.description: Design and test techniques for high-speed digital systems operating at rates above 100 MHz with a practical emphasis via substantial projects.

courses.title: Fault Tolerant Computing
courses.description: Key concepts in fault-tolerant computing.  Understanding and use of modern fault-tolerant hardware and software design practices. Case studies.

courses.title: Advanced Signal Processing Theory
courses.description: A lecture and seminar treatment of the latest developments in signal processing.  Emphasis is placed on current literature and emerging research areas.

courses.title: Topics in Analytical Electromagnetics
courses.description: An in-depth treatment of several analytical techniques used in current practice for solving real-world EM wave propagation problems and their impact on wireless communications.

courses.title: Topics in Computational Electromagnetics
courses.description: Computational approaches for applications such as radar signature prediction, microwave antenna and device design, and modeling techniques for electronic packaging.

courses.title: Are You Thinking of Becoming An Academic?
courses.description: How to run a successful research program, advise students, apply and get a job in academia, navigate promotion and tenure, and other aspects of academia.

courses.title: Future Faculty Practicum
courses.description: The objective of the proposed class is to prepare students interested in applying for faculty positions for interview season and for successful start of academic career. After this class, students will have prepared material for applying for academic positions as well as developed interview talk with detailed feedback.

courses.title: Robotics Professional Preparation
courses.description: Preparation for a professional career in Robotics. Local & visiting speakers. Program introduction. Technical resume preparation. GT Robotics labs & resources.

courses.title: Robotics Professional Preparation 2
courses.description: Preparation for a professional career in Robotics. Local & visiting speakers. Selecting and applying for Internship. Developing capstone project proposal. Public speaking practice and preparation.

courses.title: Robotics Professional Preparation 3
courses.description: Preparation for a professional career in Robotics. Local & visiting speakers. Interview preparation & career search. Technical report writing and presentation.

courses.title: Mathematical Foundations of Machine Learning
courses.description: Provides the mathematical background for two of the pillars of modern data science: linear algebra and applied probability.

courses.title: Probabilistic Graphical Models in Machine Learning
courses.description: The course provides an introduction to theory and practice of graphical models in machine learning. It covers three main aspects; representation, probabilistic inference, and learning.

courses.title: Introduction to Robotics Research
courses.description: Familiarizes students with the core areas of robotics; mechanics, control, perception, AI, and autonomy. Provides an introduction to the mathematical tools required in robotics research.

courses.title: Preparation for Doctoral Qualifying Examination
courses.description: This course is reseved for students who are studying for the ECE Preliminary Exam.

courses.title: ECE Seminar
courses.description: Speakers with diverse backgrounds and representing many different industries, professions, and institutions describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

courses.title: ECE Seminar
courses.description: Speakers with diverse backgrounds and representing different industries, professions, and institutions describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

courses.title: Research Seminar
courses.description: Seminar presentations describing ECE-related research projects, centers, and other activities at Georgia Tech.

courses.title: Professional Communication Seminar
courses.description: Seminar presentations on oral and written technical communication skills needed by electrical and computer engineering professionals. Credit for this course may not be used toward the master's degree in ECE.

courses.title: Robotics Internship
courses.description: Graduate Internship at a partner company, GTRI or a GT Robotics lab.

courses.title: Robotics Capstone Project
courses.description: Teams or individuals apply the knowledge and skills acquired throughout the MS program to a faculty supervised robotics project.

courses.title: Robotics Research Foundation I
courses.description: Multidisciplinary research course supervised by two robotics faculty from different schools participating in the robotics Ph.D. program.

courses.title: Robotics Research Foundation II
courses.description: Continuation of AE 8751 (Robotics Research Foundation I).

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics in ECE.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: special topics.

courses.title: Teaching Assistantship
courses.description: For students holding graduate teaching assistantships.

courses.title: Research Assistantship
courses.description: For students holding graduate research assistantships.

courses.title: Preparation for Doctoral Dissertation
courses.description: This course is reserved for students who are actively seeking Ph.D. advisors and /or dissertation topics.
